Male.description: Black-backed Woodpeckers have a solid black back, whereas American Three-toed Woodpeckers have at least some barring on the back.

Female (Rocky Mts.).description: Hairy Woodpeckers have a white patch down the center of the back, whereas America Three-toed Woodpeckers have barring on the back (except populations in the Rockies, which have less barring).

Male (Rocky Mts.).description: Hairy Woodpeckers have unmarked sides, whereas American Three-toed Woodpeckers have barred sides.

Female (Rocky Mts.).description: Downy Woodpeckers are smaller and lack the barred sides of American Three-toed Woodpeckers.
